description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5fsbn","text":"The highly conserved, cardiotonic steroid binding site (also termed ouabain binding site) on the primary α subunit of Na,K-ATPase plays a receptor signaling role in a range of vital cell processes and is a therapeutic target for human disease. Mouse lines with altered affinity for cardiotonic steroids on the α1 or α2 subunit isoform of Na,K-ATPase, developed by the late Dr. Jerry Lingrel and collaborators, are a valuable tool for studying its physiological roles and drug actions. In one model, the normally ouabain resistant α1 isoform was rendered sensitive to ouabain binding. In a second model, the normally sensitive α2 isoform was rendered resistant to ouabain binding.Additional useful models are obtained by mating these mice. To further advance their use, we developed a rapid, real-time PCR method that amplifies digested tail clip samples without the need to isolate DNA, and detects mutant alleles using specific primers and fluorescent probes. PCR is performed in fast mode with up to 15 samples processed in 40 min. The method was validated by comparing results with a previous two-step method using PCR amplification followed by gel electrophoresis, and by Sanger sequencing. We also clarified inconsistencies in published sequences, updated numbering to current reference sequences, and confirmed the continued presence of the mutations in the colony. It is expected that the wider availability of these models and a more efficient genotyping protocol will advance studies of the Na,K-ATPase and its cardiotonic steroid receptor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
image_attribution: Diagrams created by BioRender.com. Screenshots from ABI StepOne software.
keywords: SWAP mouse,ATP1A1,ATP1A2,Ouabain binding site,Mouse models,NaK ATPase

{"blocks":[{"key":"bbikj","text":"Create a new experiment on your PCR machine's software. The instructions here are based on ABI StepOne machines but other manufacturers' procedures are generally similar. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqcnb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3g85b","text":"Templates for ABI StepOne and StepOnePlus machines are attached, which have the probe list and thermocycling program pre-set. To use the templates, download the version corresponding to your machine type. Open StepOne Software and choose [File] -\u003e [New Experiment] -\u003e [From Template...] and select the template file. {"blocks":[{"key":"dv146","text":"Assign 8 wells for each sample (including the NTC); 2 wells for a1R, 2 wells for a1S, 2 wells for a2S, and 2 wells for a2R. {"blocks":[{"key":"3uhen","text":"Prepare 4 reaction mixes as follows, 1 for each of the assay mixes. Create enough mix for the total number of reactions of each assay on your plate map, plus 2 extra to account for potential pipetting loss. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9kbbq","text":"For example, the plate shown in Step 11 (having 5 samples + 1 NTC) would need a 14 rxn mix for each assay. {"blocks":[{"key":"af3nj","text":"Pipet   reaction mix into each well of a fresh PCR plate. {"blocks":[{"key":"qsjb","text":"Pipet   of each diluted sample into its assigned wells. Pipet   ddH2O into each no-template control well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":62,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"al65e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"496582A0554011EC906D65DB7D02B5C4","id":"89376","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"66232550554011EC906D65DB7D02B5C4","id":"89377","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6j3o0","text":"Cover the plate with optical sealing film. Ensure that the film is fully adhered to the plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3eq4p","text":"Briefly vortex the plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2988r","text":"Centrifuge the plate at   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":24,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3a4l3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"1700","duration":120,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"C65722F0554011EC906D65DB7D02B5C4","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bnhl8","text":"Insert the plate into the instrument and initiate the run. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgskj","text":"Analysis of the PCR results begins by checking the outcome of the negative control wells. If all NTC wells show no amplification, you may proceed with the analysis. If one or more negative control wells show amplification, the results are invalid and the experiment must be repeated. An invalid outcome is typically due to contamination of the reaction mix or of a reagent. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a78g7","text":"Genotyping is based on the presence or absence of signal from the 2 probes of each gene. The example below shows representative amplification plots for the possible genotypes of α1 (A) and α2 (B). The graphs show results from a sample's α1R (black) and α1S (red) wells plotted together (A), and a sample's α2S (black) and α2R (blue) wells plotted together (B). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":182,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":193,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":287,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":357,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":239,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":255,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":308,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":324,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7iri8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bl81","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpf7s","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"alvug","text":"Samples considered positive for a specific allele show CT values of 26-31 for the corresponding probe, while negative samples do not reach threshold in 35 cycles. Heterozygous samples show amplification of both probes within 2 CT of each-other.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":56,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":228,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"i165","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqpi6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7a1q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5afl2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"E877BBE06CEE11ECA2003B2337DB9AE2","height":535,"id":223299,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cj816","text":"Representative amplification curves","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Combined plots version for Protocols.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4cfbpjux.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4cdbpjux.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4cebpjux.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4ccbpjux.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"159bc","text":"Enter the 4 probes into the targets list as per the following table. Populate the sample list with your mouse sample numbers, plus a no-template control (NTC) sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dsrm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69j67","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3nm1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Probe","Reporter","Quencher"],"colWidths":[100,100,100],"data":[["a1R","VIC","None"],["a1S","FAM","None"],["a2S","FAM","None"],["a2R","FAM","None"]],"guid":"86DA7B20AFA611EC8AA45B65F40E6DF2","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8unfe","text":"Genotyping probe configurations","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["a1R","VIC","None"],["a1S","FAM","None"],["a2S","FAM","None"],["a2R","FAM","None"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}}}}
